intro: Duguetia sulcosa, commonly known as the red-veined arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, arrowhead-shaped leaves with red veins. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its vibrant foliage. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Duguetia sulcosa is also valued for its edible tubers, which are used in local cuisines.
